suncertify.db
Interface TableRequestManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleRequestManager
public interface TableRequestManager

Interface for something that manages concurrent requests to a Table. Implementors must be thread safe.

Method Summary

Method Detail

getMatchingRecords

java.util.Collection<Record> getMatchingRecords(java.lang.String[] criteria)
Get the record numbers of all records that match the given criteria. Deleted records are never returned. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Parameters:
criteria - an array of Strings corresponding to the fields of a record. Any entry may be null.
Returns:
a collection of matching records

lock

void lock(int recordNumber,
          DBMain client,
          SerialNumber lastKnownTimestamp)
          throws RecordNotFoundException,
                 StaleRecordException
Lock the record with the given record number. The record must exist and not be deleted. If the record is already locked by this client, nothing will happen. If the record is locked by some other client, this thread will wait until the record is available. If an exception is thrown, the record will not be locked.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
client - the client requesting the lock
lastKnownTimestamp - what the record's timestamp was when the client last read the record
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted.
StaleRecordException - if lastKnownTimestamp is older than the record's timestamp

unlock

void unlock(int recordNumber,
            DBMain client,
            SerialNumber lastKnownTimestamp)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   StaleRecordException,
                   RecordNotLockedException
Unlock the record with the given record number. The record must exist and not be marked as deleted. The record must be locked by the client.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
client - the client requesting the lock
lastKnownTimestamp - what the record's timestamp was when the client last read the record
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted.
StaleRecordException - if the client's copy of the timestamp for the record is older than the record's timestamp
RecordNotLockedException - if the client does not hold the lock for the requested record

isRecordLocked

boolean isRecordLocked(int recordNumber)
                       throws RecordNotFoundException
Returns the current lock status of the given record.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number. Starts at 0.
Returns:
true if the record is currently locked by any client
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted.

getRecord

Record getRecord(int recordNumber)
                 throws RecordNotFoundException
Get the specified Record. The Record is checked to make sure it exists and is not marked as "deleted".

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
Returns:
the Record (guaranteed not to be null)
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted.

modifyRecord

SerialNumber modifyRecord(int recordNumber,
                          DBMain client,
                          SerialNumber lastKnownTimestamp,
                          java.util.List<Field> newFields)
                          throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                 StaleRecordException,
                                 java.io.IOException,
                                 RecordNotLockedException
Modify a record. The record must exist and not be marked as deleted.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
client - the client requesting the lock
lastKnownTimestamp - what the record's timestamp was when the client last read the record
newFields - the new Field values for the record. Any element may be null, in which case the field will remain unchanged. The elements must be in the order defined by the table schema.
Returns:
the record's new timestamp
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted.
StaleRecordException - if the client's copy of the timestamp for the record is older than the record's timestamp
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem writing the file
RecordNotLockedException - if the client does not hold the lock for the requested record
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newFields is has the wrong number of fields, or cannot be parsed

deleteRecord

SerialNumber deleteRecord(int recordNumber,
                          DBMain client,
                          SerialNumber lastKnownTimestamp)
                          throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                 StaleRecordException,
                                 java.io.IOException,
                                 RecordNotLockedException
Mark the requested record for deletion. A record that is marked as "deleted" can be overwritten by a new record. The client must hold a lock for the record. The client will lose the lock unless an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
client - the client requesting the lock
lastKnownTimestamp - what the record's timestamp was when the client last read the record
Returns:
the new serial number of the record that is to be marked as deleted
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem updating the file
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted.
StaleRecordException - if the client's copy of the timestamp for the record is older than the record's timestamp
RecordNotLockedException - if the client does not hold the lock for the requested record

createRecord

Record createRecord(java.util.List<Field> fields)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Create a new Record with the given field values.

Parameters:
fields - the field values to use
Returns:
the newly created Record
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem writing the file

getSchema

TableSchema getSchema()
Get the table schema.

Returns:
the table schema

getFieldParsers

FieldParsers getFieldParsers()
Get the parsers for the table's fields.

Returns:
the field parsers

getFieldListFromStringArray

java.util.List<Field> getFieldListFromStringArray(java.lang.String[] fieldsAsStrings)
Get a list of fields representing the given array of strings. Each field will be in the format expected by the corresponding Field's parser.

Parameters:
fieldsAsStrings - the array of string values
Returns:
a list of fields representing the given strings

getStringArrayFromFieldList

java.lang.String[] getStringArrayFromFieldList(java.util.List<Field> fields)
Get an array of strings representing the given list of fields. Each string will be in the format expected by the corresponding Field's parser.

Parameters:
fields - the list of fields
Returns:
an array of strings representing the given fields

shutDown

void shutDown()
Perform a graceful shutdown.
